initSubCategories.classificationName: Listing, Connection, Download and Updated Info

guides.guideTitle: How to manage your Inventory List Part 1
guides.guideContent:
First, log in to your Retailer account. Click “Inventory List” on the left navigation pane.

Inventory List acts as a portal. On this page, you will find all the products you’ve been adding to the Inventory List.

Let’s see the actual list first. By default, the products are sorted by Add Time, the newest product will be shown first on the list. You may choose to sort them by Add Time, Inventory, or Price, as you like.

You can see the names and pictures of the products, their prices, inventory, and the actions you may take to manage them.

By default, all the products added will be shown. You may view and manage particular products by selecting these options:

Tags, click to select the tags you’ve defined when you were adding the products to the Inventory List. You may also choose “UnTagged” to show the products to which you haven’t added any tags.

Category, click to select a category to show all the products that belong to this category.

Add Time, you may choose today only, or the past week, or the past month.

Listing status, click the show all the products already listed to your stores, or all the ones that haven’t been listed to your stores.

Download status, click the show all the products already downloaded to your computer, or all the ones that haven’t been downloaded to your computer.

Unavailable Products, click on this checkbox to show all the products with zero inventory. You may use this option to show and remove all the unavailable products.

Search Products, here you may enter the name of the Item Number of the product to search them.

After any of these options are clicked, checked, or searched, you may click “Reset” to return to the original list.

guides.guideTitle: How to manage your Inventory List Part 2
guides.guideContent:
On the top, you will see how many products you have listed in your stores, you can list up to 2000 products (Business Plan) to your stores totally. And you may click here to View Listing History.

You will see how many products you have downloaded to your computer, you can download up to 2000 products to your computer per month. And you may click here to View Download History, and click here to enter the “Downloaded File Center” to actually download the products‘ data.

For any single product, you may click “List to Store” and list it directly to your store, such as Shopify. We will explain this process in detail in another video.

You may click “More Actions”, then “Download” to download the product data, and manually upload it to your store, such as Amazon, which doesn’t support the “List to Store” option at the moment. Again, we will explain this process in detail in another video.

You may click “Add to cart” to add this product to your Shopping Cart, then click the Cart symbol to place and pay for an order.

If you haven’t added any Tag to your product, or you want to add more Tags, you may click “Add Tags” to add one or more. If you already added a Tag to your product, you may click “Edit Tags” to check or uncheck tags or add new ones. You may also click the “Tag Management” button to manage all your tags in one place, such as add new ones, rename or delete the current ones, or choose Monitor the certain tag or not. We’ll tell you about Tag Management and Monitoring in detail in another video.

Finally, if you find this product uninteresting, you may click “Remove” to remove this product from your Inventory List.

Just above the list, you may find these four bulk-action buttons. To use them, click on this checkbox to select all the products in your Inventory List, or check two or more products. The actual actions are the same as we just mentioned. Be careful with the “Select All” and “Remove” actions, because this will remove all the products from your Inventory List.

Step 1: if you want to know the newest information of your listing, you should enter the listings page, In there you could confirm all of changing information from items, such as: Sales Price, Inventory.

Step 2: If you want to hide some items, You could select Multiple products then click“Hide from Store”， if you want to delete some items, you should click“Delete”.

guides.guideTitle: How to list Doba products to Shopify Part 1?
guides.guideContent:
Method 1: ”list it to store” option in the product detail page >> Click "List it to Store" button and list it to your Shopify store

Method 2: ”list it to store” option in the “inventory list” page

Steps 1 Find products you want to list to your Shopify store >> Add it/them to the Inventory List >> Click "List it to Store" button and list it/them to your Shopify store

（NOTE：you can batch uploading less than 100 items at one time）

Step 2 Click "List it to Store" button >> Choose a platform & store & site and click "Continue" button >> Set your retailer price & edit your products info >> List products successfully

You can edit products info:

You can set your retailer price via entering your target profit:

You can also edit the product information after you listed it to shopify store successfully.

Method 3: Download shopify-product list format in DOBA backend then Upload it to shopify store

Note: If you use Method 2 to list products to your shopify store, the inventory and price information of the products on your shopify store will not sync with DOBA automatically.

guides.guideTitle: How to list Doba products to Shopify Part 2?
guides.guideContent:
Method 1: ”list it to store” option in the product detail page >> Click "List it to Store" button and list it to your Shopify store

Method 2: ”list it to store” option in the “inventory list” page

Steps 1 Find products you want to list to your Shopify store >> Add it/them to the Inventory List >> Click "List it to Store" button and list it/them to your Shopify store

 

（NOTE：you can batch uploading less than 100 items at one time）

Step 2 Click "List it to Store" button >> Choose a platform & store & site and click "Continue" button >> Set your retailer price & edit your products info >> List products successfully

You can edit products info:

You can set your retailer price via entering your target profit:

You can also edit the product information after you listed it to shopify store successfully.

Method 3: Download shopify-product list format in DOBA backend then Upload it to shopify store

Note: If you use Method 2 to list products to your shopify store, the inventory and price information of the products on your shopify store will not sync with DOBA automatically.

guides.guideTitle: How to check the listing and download history?
guides.guideContent:
Step1:click “inventory list” option >> you can choose the products you listed before under the “listed products” option.

Step2: click “view download history” & “download file center”, you can find the products or the product file you downloaded before.

Step 1:  If you want to download the item information, you should enter the inventory list, then select the items you want.

Step 2:  Please click“Download”the format you need, we have many different formats for you to choose.

guides.guideTitle: How to list Doba products to Woocommerce?
guides.guideContent:
Step 1 Log in your DOBA account >> click “Search product” searching products you want to sell on Woocommerce store >> click “Add to Inventory List” 

Step 2 Click “Inventory List” to inventory list page >> click “More Actions" and a click "Download" in the drop-down menu or check "Select All" to bulk download products in DOBA format or 3rd party format products file

Step 3 Download Woocommerce format products file from DOBA >> Upload Woocommerce products file to Woocommerce store

guides.guideTitle: How to list DOBA products to Bigcommerce?
guides.guideContent:
Steps 1 Find products you want to list to your Bigcommerce store >> Add it/them to the Inventory List >> Click "List it to Store" button and list it/them to your Bigcommerce store

Step 2 Click "List it to Store" button >> Choose a platform & store & site and click "Continue" button >> Set your retailer price & edit your products info >> List products successfully

Step 3 Click “Inventory List” to inventory list page >> put a check mark next to the items that you wish to export & press Download >> download Bigcommerce format products file from DOBA

Step 4 Go to your BigCommerce account & click on “Products- Import” option >> Choose the file you downloaded from DOBA and choose the “inport options” then click “Next” >> If the information in the “Link Import Fields ” is correct then click”Next”

Step 5 click “Start Import” and start to list the items to your bigcommerce store

5.1 If everything works, you can press “View Imported Products”

5.2 If there are any failed projects, it will let you know the clear reasons for the failure as below screenshot shown. You need to figure out why it failed, fix it, and reload it

guides.guideTitle: How to list Doba products to Amazon?
guides.guideContent:
Step 1 Log in your DOBA account >> click “Search product” searching products you want to sell on Amazon store >> click “Add to Inventory List” 

Step 2 Click “Inventory List” to inventory list page >> click “More Actions" and a click "Download" in the drop-down menu or check "Select All" to bulk download products in DOBA format or 3rd party format products file

 

Step 3 Download Amazon inventory template from Amazon >> Copy and paste products info from doba products file to Amazon inventory template >> Upload edited Amazon inventory template to Amazon store

guides.guideTitle: How to list Doba products to eBay?
guides.guideContent:
Method 1: ”list it to store” option in the product detail page >> Click "List it to Store" button and list it to your eBay store

Method 2: ”list it to store” option in the “inventory list” page

Steps 1 Find products you want to list to your eBay store >> Add it/them to the Inventory List >> Click "List it to Store" button and list it/them to your eBay store

（NOTE：you can batch uploading less than 100 items at one time）

 

Step 2 Click "List it to Store" button >> Choose a platform & store & site and click "Continue" button >> Set your retailer price & edit your products info >> List products successfully

You can edit products info:

Listing policy here is your eBay business policy. Please check you have set business policy in your eBay backend. (If your eBay business policy still not be synced here, please handle update your business policy or refresh your ebay connection.) 

Method 2: Download products list(csv.) format in DOBA backend then Upload it to eBay store

Note: If you use Method 2 to list products to your eBay store, the inventory and price information of the products on your eBay store will not sync with DOBA automatically.

Note: After you listed the products to your ebay store, you can also edit the products information via “Listings”-“Edit Product” option in the DOBA backend.

If you want to change a product Connection, follow these steps:

Step 1：Enter your Doba Center >> click “Connection” option, then you will see all the products you have added before.

Step 2：Click the "Edit" button on the right to Edit connection information. In the edit window, you can modify the Store SKU and Fulfillment Latency information here if you need.

Step 3：If you want to change Doba product Item No, you need to modify "Product Name" and click "Change" button to change the new product Item No. Then click "Check" button to confirm the product information,if the product information is correct, click "Save" again to save your change.

If you want to delete a product Connection, follow these steps:

Step 1: Click the "Delete" button on the right to Delete connection information.

Step 2: If you want to delete multiple product connections at one time, you can click "Select All" in the upper left corner of the page to delete product connections in batches.

Noted: Shopify and eBay platforms does not require manually adding a connection, so connection information cannot be edited or deleted.

Step 1：Enter the Doba Center, click “Connection” in the drop-down bar of "My Products" in the left menu, and enter the Connection page, then Click "Import Connections" in the upper right corner to bind Connections in batches.

Step 2: Click "Download Excel Template" in the pop-up window to Download the Template. After downloading, open the Template and fill in the following four contents: Platform. Store Name, Store SKU, Store Product Name and Doba Item Number.

guides.guideTitle: How to connect store SKU and doba item number?
guides.guideContent:
Before clicking "Purchase Order" button in "Store Orders" to quick place your orders, you have to handle connect Store SKU to the Item Number. 

Step 1 Confirm your store SKU connect to which product Item Number on DOBA >> copy your store SKU and Item Number

Step 2 Log in your DOBA account > click “Connection” in the left sidebar > click “ Add Sourcing Connection”

Step 3 Fill in all blank columns with red sign > paste your store SKU and Item Number > click “Check”

Step 4 Click “Add Now” > a pop-up showing you connected successfully > click “ Confirm” or “Continue to Add” as you wishStep 5 Click “Confirm” > see the connection you have added just now

Step 1: Click "Notification Settings" button to set notification rule >> Click "Add a New Notification Rule" button to set email notification rule

Step 2: Fill in Rule Name & Choose tag file & Choose frequency >> Done & click "Confirm" button to complete email notification rule >> Any update of the products in the tag file you choosed that you will receive mail alert according to your email notificatioin rule

If you want to edit or delete the notification, you should click the “Notification Settings”, then you could edit or delete the notification info in the pop-up windows.

Step 1 Click "Notification Settings" button to set notification rule >> Click "Add a New Notification Rule" button to set email notification rule.

Step 2 Fill in Rule Name >> Click your register email account or enter a new email address to receive this email.

Step 3 choose the frequency you want then the system will send the email to you according to your need. We have daily and weekly options for you choose.

guides.guideTitle: How to use and manager tags in inventory List?
guides.guideContent:
If you want to know how to use and manager the tags in the Inventory List, please follow these steps:

Step 1 Click products to product detail page >> Click "Add to Inventory List" button and add products to inventory list 

Step 2 A pop-up showed up to choose one of tag or add new tag to add products to the tag you choose >> Click "Confirm" button and add products to the tag choosed >> Go to Inventory List page and see the products add and a tag showed beside it

Step 3 Click "Tag Management" button to see the products collection file you added, you can click "Add New Tags" as well to add new products file

Step 4 Add s on products to make products collection first >> Click "Tag Management" button to tag management page >> Turn on the Monitor switch to track products update on the tag file basis, And also you could delete the tag in there >> Any update of the products in the tag file monitored will show in the "Update Info" page

Step 5 Click "Notification Settings" button to set notification rule >> Click "Add a New Notification Rule" button to set email notification rule

Step 6 Fill in Rule Name & Choose tag file & Choose frequency >> Done & click "Confirm" button to complete email notification rule >> Any update of the products in the tag file you choosed that you will receive mail alert according to your email notificatioin rule
